name: Villa Vlastel 2
description:
The playful eastern coastline of Istria, where the verdant landscape touches, tickles, and gently pinches the azure sea, creates a sense of intimacy with the deep blue expanse. Here, where the playful interaction between land and sea has evolved into a nearly intimate relationship, nestled within the green peninsula, lies Porto Longo. Historically, this area once served as the main pier for the boats of ancient medieval Labin.

The seaside pathway is an experience in itself, yet the full enchantment of the view is revealed from the elevated vantage point, well before one encounters the stone’s heat or the salty sea spray. From the narrow road leading from the colorful old town of Labin to the bay, a magical vista suddenly unfolds, clearly signaling that this is a paradise for the body and a sanctuary for the mind.

Surrounded by the fragrant scents of immortelle and sage, and bathed in the relentless summer sun, one feels an immersion into the turquoise crystal waters of the Adriatic. The host is dedicated to enhancing your stay, available for all information, reservations, and any assistance you may require.

Situated on the east coast of Istria, near the town of Labin, in the protected bay of Duga Luka – Prtlog, the property is just 30 meters from the sea. The nearest town, Labin, is 5 km away, with shops, restaurants, and markets also 5 km distant. The villa itself, constructed in 2018, covers 2,500 m² and features a mix of six types of stone, wood, stainless steel, and aluminum, complete with thermal insulation and high-speed Wi-Fi throughout.

The outdoor area boasts a 50 m² pool with countercurrent swimming and water heating, a hydromassage bath, private parking for 3 to 4 cars, various pool recreation sets, direct sea access, a private pontoon for swimming and sunbathing, a boat mooring, an outdoor barbecue with kitchen and dining area, and a relaxation zone. Inside, the villa offers a wellness center with infrared and Finnish/bio saunas, an experience shower, a waterbed, a gym with running equipment, an orbitrack, a stationary bike, and weights, as well as billiards, darts, an indoor decorative fireplace, SMART UHD TVs in each room, a Bose 5-zone HI-FI system, a PlayStation center for video games, and energy-saving SMART solutions ensuring comfort and security. The villa is equipped with central heating and cooling, a fire detection system, and keyless entry.

The villa provides complete privacy, does not allow pets or smoking indoors (though smoking is permitted on terraces), and offers a surface area of 513 m². It features five bedrooms, each with a private bath, a living room, a kitchen with a dining area, a heated outdoor pool, and an outdoor hot tub for five people.

The indoor wellness area includes fitness equipment, billiards, darts, an outdoor covered area with a gas Weber grill, private parking, an olive grove with 20 olive trees, and a horticulturally maintained environment. The property also provides private sea access and a pontoon for sunbathing. Guests are given three towels per person per day, one set of bed linen per week, a washer and dryer, an iron and ironing board, daily pool and sunbed cleaning, weekly horticultural maintenance, and a person available daily for information and assistance.

Villa VIastelini II features five double bedrooms across two levels. On the first floor, two bedrooms share a stylish living room, while three additional bedrooms are located on the ground level. All bedrooms have private bathrooms with showers, air conditioning, and UHD Smart TVs. The FLACIUS bedroom, located on the ground level, reflects the peninsula’s colors with its spacious double bed, separate wardrobe area, and luxurious bathroom, offering an unobstructed sea view and the villa’s largest terrace of up to 15 m². The VLASTELIN room, named after the Vlačić family, blends antique touches with modern elegance, featuring a separate closet area, a cosmetic table, and a spacious terrace overlooking the sea. The DORSI room stands out with its bold decorative elements and abstract blue headboard, providing an ideal sea view from the bed. The DUGA LUKA room is characterized by modern lines and grey hues, reflecting the coastal stone, and opens onto a 10 m² terrace with a sofa and sea view. The PRTLOG room on the upper level, with side sea views and separate beds, is designed primarily for children but offers full comfort for adults as well.
